alert.note: Alert for Beaufort; Charleston (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 16 at 9:34PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, Beaufort, Charleston, Colleton, Hampton and Jasper. * WHEN...Until 1130 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 931 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated numerous thunderstorms with heavy rain extending from western Charleston County through much of southern Colleton County, northern and central Beaufort County into northern Jasper County. Rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches can be expected for some areas through 1130 PM, resulting in minor flooding of low-lying and poor drainage areas. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Beaufort, Ridgeland, Yemassee, Clarendon, Hollywood, Ravenel, Meggett, Dale, Gardens Corner, White Hall, Sheldon, Green Pond, Beaufort Marine Corps Air Station, Pocotaligo, Ashepoo, Laurel Bay, Burton, McPhersonville, Coosawhatchie and Bennetts Point.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
